intro: Micranthes leptarrhenifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. Its small white or greenish flowers appear in late spring to early summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
